snippet.title: Canberra man pleads guilty to ANU, UC robberies targeting Asian students
snippet.content: A man has pleaded guilty to a string of violent robberies against Asian students at Canberra's universities. he and a co-offender targeted students as they walked or cycled alone at night at the University of Canberra and the Australian National University. He was arrested after in numerous on-campus attacks in late 2016. Police said he committed four aggravated robberies over six days from October 22. Scott will avoid trial after he switched his pleas in the ACT Supreme Court on Tuesday. He pleaded guilty to six counts of aggravated robbery and four charges of obtaining property by deception. He had previously admitted to two robberies on a second weekend. Scott is in custody and did not apply for bail. He returns to court on September 26 for sentencing.
